list.name: Arthur Duarte
list.testimony:
Forget the stock market - invest your money in access to people and knowledge instead.
Last year I paid to join a coding community with fellow Brazilian developers, and it completely changed my life.
Being around different people who all had the same goals and were looking for the same things made me realize how important community and the right guidance really are.
I genuinely feel like paying for access to people is the best investment you can make.
Put your money towards knowledge and access to people and places.

list.name: Thiago Valverde
list.testimony:
Name: Thiago Valverde de Souza
Previous role: Backend Developer
Salary before mentorship: USD 13k
Current role: Web3 Developer / Backend Developer
Current salary: $22k
Experience: 24 years old
Mentorship length: 1 month
Strategies: Job through applications. Created some repos but didn’t share on code up yet.
4 hours/day applying with customized CV and cover letter.
Web3 study, aligning speech to get a job abroad - Self learner talking about other career shifts.
In 1 month there were 19 processes where I passed the initial screening, 3 offers declined because they were not the desired rate or were web2.

WhatIs.title: What is BASE Mentorship?
WhatIs.description: The BASE Mentorship is a structured, practical program for early-career tech professionals who want to break out of the national market and prepare for global opportunities. Led by Yuri Pereira and the Borderless Coding mentor team, BASE is designed to:
bullets: Improve your English for interviews and collaboration
Position you for future entry into the PSP Mentorship program
WhatIs.highlight: This is not a generic bootcamp or online course — it is a <highlight>guided path</highlight> to transform you from a talented local developer into a globally competitive candidate

WhatIs.title: What is PSP Mentorship?
WhatIs.description: The Programador Sem Pátria (PSP) Mentorship is a high-performance career acceleration program designed for experienced Brazilian tech professionals who are ready to play in the global market. Led by Yuri Pereira, founder of Borderless Coding, PSP combines strategic positioning, technical interview mastery, networking, and direct mentorship to create predictable international job offers.
WhatIs.highlight: Over 105+ alumni have already landed roles in companies from the US, Canada, Europe, and Asia — many with salaries ranging from $5K to $15K/month.

WhoIsItFor.title: The PSP Mentorship is built for <italic>mid-to-senior-level</italic> tech professionals:

requirements.title: Requirements
items: English level: B1 or higher (we help you get to technical fluency)
Ready to work remotely for international companies

WhyItWorks.title: Most career advice for devs is <italic>generic, outdated, or purely theoretical</italic>. The PSP Mentorship gives you:
features: Direct access to a mentor who has personally scaled from $5K to $90K/month in tech contracts
5 specialized mentors for diverse interview preparation
A clear, step-by-step system validated with 105+ success stories
A high-performance community that keeps you accountable
